title: 12 Ways to Meet Other LGBTQ+ People in a Small Community

steps.title: Download an app if you’re looking for guys to date.
steps.content: Download an app if you’re looking for guys to date. Matchmaker and dating coach Lauren Sanders says “There are several ways to meet other members of the LGBTQ+ community. One of the best ways is via LGBTQ+ centered dating apps.” [1] X Expert Source Lauren Sanders Matchmaker & Dating Coach Expert Interview. Wednesday, April 26, 2023. Some of the most popular apps for gay men include Grindr , Scruff , GROWLR , and Archer . [2] X Research source Other apps include MenNation , Adam4Adam , eHarmony , OkCupid , or JACK’D . If you meet someone online, try to have your first in-person interaction in a public area and send the address to a friend you can trust.

steps.title: Use Facebook or Instagram to find other local gay guys.
steps.content: Use Facebook or Instagram to find other local gay guys. Whether you’re looking for love or community, Sanders also recommends trying to find LGBTQ+ Facebook groups. [3] X Expert Source Lauren Sanders Matchmaker & Dating Coach Expert Interview. Wednesday, April 26, 2023. Instagram, Twitter, and other social media sites might also have groups where you can meet gay guys online. Search for the word “gay” plus the name of your town to find openly queer users in your area. If you have an Instagram and you're looking for gay men in Idaho, for example, you could search "gay Rexburg Idaho." If there aren’t any groups in your area, try searching for groups in a nearby town or city.

steps.title: Join Meetup and look for gay-friendly clubs.
steps.content: Join Meetup and look for gay-friendly clubs. Verified Meetup groups can be a great place to engage in a hobby you enjoy while meeting gay people in your area. Whether you’re into D&D, board games, meditation, hiking, or sports, Meetup might be a good place to meet gay men and other queer individuals. [4] X Research source You might also be able to find LGBTQ-friendly Facebook groups for activities.

steps.title: Join a gay online chat room or chat on a forum.
steps.content: Join a gay online chat room or chat on a forum. Chat rooms or forums can be a quick way to talk with other gay men and post questions you have about the queer community. Search for chat rooms and forums focused on your area or join a general LGBTQ chat room to find advice about meeting gay men in small towns. Some forums include Reddit or LGBTHero . You can also search for LGBTQ-friendly forums for a video game or tv show you enjoy. If you're between 13 and 24 years old, TrevorSpace is a safe, welcoming forum and chatroom for LGBTQ youth.

steps.title: Build a safe space online by finding an LGBTQ+ social support group.
steps.content: Build a safe space online by finding an LGBTQ+ social support group. Support groups are a safe place for queer people to come together and talk about their experiences, which can make it a great place to find friends or people to date. [5] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source The LGBT Life Center has a list of virtual support groups, or you can search for gay support groups on Psychology Today . There might also be support groups hosted by LGBTQ+ centers in nearby cities or larger towns.

steps.title: Go to gay bars, lounges, or clubs in other large towns.
steps.content: Go to gay bars, lounges, or clubs in other large towns. Queer nightclubs, bars, and other spaces can be a great place to meet other gay or queer men. If your town isn’t near a city or somewhere with LGBTQ+ safe spaces, look for online events hosted by queer businesses across the country. [6] X Research source Look at sites like EventBrite , LGBTNetwork , or on the social media pages for gay bars or clubs for online events. Some cities or large towns might also have LGBTQ+ book clubs or other events for people under the legal drinking age. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Start a long-distance relationship online.
steps.content: Start a long-distance relationship online. Join an online dating site or app and expand the distance requirements to outside of your town. Message any users who interest you and, if you feel a spark, ask them if they're open to long-distance relationships. With time and persistence, you may find someone you want to start an LDR with. [8] X Research source You may also connect with and eventually develop a long-distance relationship with a member from an LGBTQ group, forum, or chat room. Scruff’s Venture feature is a popular way to meet gay men in faraway cities or while traveling.

steps.title: Volunteer at a queer organization in another town or city.
steps.content: Volunteer at a queer organization in another town or city. If your town is close enough to a larger town or city where there are LGBTQ+ organizations, find local events or volunteer opportunities you can participate in. A few national organizations include: Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Family Equality Council Parents, Family & Friends of Lesbians and Gays (PFLAG) International Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Trans and Intersex Association (ILGA) The LGBT National Help Center Gay & Lesbian Advocates & Defenders (GLAD)

steps.title: Locate a city near you that throws Pride events.
steps.content: Locate a city near you that throws Pride events. Most large cities and towns throw Pride parades and festivals during June, which is LGBTQ+ Pride month. If you’re having trouble finding community in your area, travel to a Pride event in a city near you alone or with friends you can trust. [9] X Research source If you’re going to Pride alone, clinical psychologist Ketari Berasi says to “Let another person you trust know that you will be attending the parade, and make sure you each have one another’s contact information in case you need help at any point.” [10] X Expert Source Kateri Berasi, PsyD Licensed Clinical Psychologist Expert Interview. 9 September 2021. Dr. Berasi also recommends to “Stay away from any signs of uprising or violence, know the route of the parade, and map out several places along the way where you can take a break if need be.” [11] X Expert Source Kateri Berasi, PsyD Licensed Clinical Psychologist Expert Interview. 9 September 2021. GayCities’ Pride Finder tool allows you to search for Pride events near you. This Pride Calendar also tracks events across the U.S. Volunteering at Pride festivals can also be a great way to get involved in the queer community and meet gay men.

steps.title: Create a club for LGBTQ+ people with trusted friends or adults.
steps.content: Create a club for LGBTQ+ people with trusted friends or adults. If you’re currently in school, ask a teacher you can trust to help you create a club or group for queer students. [12] X Research source You can also create a club on an app like Meetup for other LGBTQ+ individuals in your town to join. [13] X Research source Dr. Berasi says that, when you create or join an LGBTQ+ club in your area, “you can meet some great folks, and if they aren’t of particular romantic interest to you, their friends you meet may be.” [14] X Expert Source Kateri Berasi, PsyD Licensed Clinical Psychologist Expert Interview. 9 September 2021. If you go to a college or university, reach out to a professor you like and ask if you could create an LGBTQ+ club or event on campus or online.

steps.title: Find a therapist who has worked with queer people.
steps.content: Find a therapist who has worked with queer people. A therapist might help you feel less lonely or isolated. When you schedule a consultation, Dr. Berasi says to “ask them if they have experience working with LGBTQ+ folks, if this population presents any difficulties for them, and what their general approach is to working with LGBTQ+ folks.” [15] X Expert Source Kateri Berasi, PsyD Licensed Clinical Psychologist Expert Interview. 9 September 2021. Dr. Berasi says that “Oftentimes therapists who are LGBTQ+ friendly advertise as such, and this information can be found on their website, or on websites specifically hosting LGBTQ+-friendly therapists.” [16] X Expert Source Kateri Berasi, PsyD Licensed Clinical Psychologist Expert Interview. 9 September 2021. If there aren’t any therapists available in your town, try using an online therapy platform like BetterHelp or Talkspace .

steps.title: Come out to friends or family members who you trust.
steps.content: Come out to friends or family members who you trust. A friend or family member might be able to give you a sense of community or help you meet other queer people nearby. However, it’s important to put your own safety first. If you don’t think your friends or family would react well, it may be best to find support online or in other towns instead. [17] X Research source Figure out how they feel about LGBTQ+ people and topics so you can see how they might react to you coming out. For example, you might ask how they feel about a queer celebrity. Start by coming out to people who you know will be supportive so you can have a good support system from the beginning. [18] X Research source If you’re a teenager and you don’t think your parents will react well, it may be better to wait until you’re financially independent to come out to them. [19] X Research source
